trans-unit.source: Presents the packet information from a call to <xref:System.Net.Sockets.Socket.ReceiveMessageFrom*> or <xref:System.Net.Sockets.Socket.EndReceiveMessageFrom*>.

Gets the origin information of the packet that was received as a result of calling the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.Socket.ReceiveMessageFrom*> method or <xref:System.Net.Sockets.Socket.EndReceiveMessageFrom*> method.

An <xref:System.Net.IPAddress> that indicates the origin information of the packet that was received as a result of calling the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.Socket.ReceiveMessageFrom*> method or <xref:System.Net.Sockets.Socket.EndReceiveMessageFrom*> method.

For packets that were sent from a unicast address, the Address property will return the <xref:System.Net.IPAddress> of the sender; for multicast or broadcast packets, the Address property will return the multicast or broadcast <xref:System.Net.IPAddress>.
Returns a value that indicates whether this instance is equal to a specified object.
The object to compare with this instance.
if comparand is an instance of and equals the value of the instance; otherwise, .
Returns the hash code for this instance.
The hash code is constructed from the values of the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.IPPacketInformation.Address%2A> and <xref:System.Net.Sockets.IPPacketInformation.Interface%2A> properties.
An Int32 hash code.
Gets the network interface information that is associated with a call to <xref:System.Net.Sockets.Socket.ReceiveMessageFrom*> or <xref:System.Net.Sockets.Socket.EndReceiveMessageFrom*>.
An <xref:System.Int32> value, which represents the index of the network interface.
You can use this index with <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterface.GetAllNetworkInterfaces*> to get more information about the relevant interface.
Tests whether two specified <xref href="System.Net.Sockets.IPPacketInformation"></xref> instances are equivalent.
This operator tests both the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.IPPacketInformation.Address%2A> and <xref:System.Net.Sockets.IPPacketInformation.Interface%2A> values for both arguments.
The <xref href="System.Net.Sockets.IPPacketInformation"></xref> instance that is to the left of the equality operator.
The <xref href="System.Net.Sockets.IPPacketInformation"></xref> instance that is to the right of the equality operator.
if packetInformation1 and packetInformation2 are equal; otherwise, .
Tests whether two specified <xref href="System.Net.Sockets.IPPacketInformation"></xref> instances are not equal.
This operator tests both the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.IPPacketInformation.Address%2A> and <xref:System.Net.Sockets.IPPacketInformation.Interface%2A> values for both arguments.
The <xref href="System.Net.Sockets.IPPacketInformation"></xref> instance that is to the left of the inequality operator.
The <xref href="System.Net.Sockets.IPPacketInformation"></xref> instance that is to the right of the inequality operator.
if packetInformation1 and packetInformation2 are unequal; otherwise, .
